data.title: Broken Telephone
data.statement:
In an exchange using a Broken Telephone, someone says a phrase but the other person only hears part of it, according to this pattern:
• If the phrase has an even number of words, only the first half of the words are heard
• If the phrase has an odd number of words, only the first, middle, and last word are heard

What words are heard?

testCases.title: Can you hear me now (Test 1)
testCases.testIn:
4
So many books so little time
What we think we become
One Two Three Four Five Six Seven
Alfa Bravo Charlie Delta
testCases.testOut:
So many books
What think become
One Four Seven
Alfa Bravo

data.constraints:
• [[phrase]] doesn't contain any punctuation: only letters, spaces and apostrophes
• [[phrase]] has more than one word in it
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read phrase:string(1024)
write those phrases as they were misheard
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]], denoting the number of phrases
<<[[n]] lines: >> A string [[phrase]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In an exchange using a Broken Telephone, someone says a phrase but the other person only hears part of it, according to this pattern:
• If the phrase has an even number of words, only the first half of the words are heard
• If the phrase has an odd number of words, only the first, middle, and last word are heard

What words are heard?
Input
Line 1: An integer n, denoting the number of phrases
n lines: A string phrase
Output
n lines: the mis-heard version of phrase
Constraints
• phrase doesn't contain any punctuation: only letters, spaces and apostrophes
• phrase has more than one word in it
Example
Input
4
So many books so little time
What we think we become
One Two Three Four Five Six Seven
Alfa Bravo Charlie Delta
Output
So many books
What think become
One Four Seven
Alfa Bravo
